page.title: 10NEASHAM VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Neasham stands on the north bank of the River Tees.A pleasant village green provides playing facilities for children and fishing is free from the river bank. There is also a mediaval ford which is still in use today. The village hall, (known locally as the Reading Room, as it was originally built by a local landowner in 1903 for men as a meeting place) is now used for all village activities. The residents must travel to the nearby village of Hurworth for both religious worship and schooling. As there is virtually no employment in the village, workers commute to Darlington, Durham and Teeside, using private transport or the one hourly bus service to Darlington.
